meanings.definition: Not equal to the standard or average
meanings.sent1: The student's nonpar performance on the test surprised the teacher.
meanings.sent2: Her nonpar height made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The nonpar amount of ice cream he ate left everyone in shock.
meanings.sent4: His nonpar skills in basketball made him a standout player.
meanings.sent5: The nonpar beauty of the sunset took her breath away.

meanings.definition: Below the usual or normal level
meanings.sent1: The nonpar temperature in the room made it uncomfortable for everyone.
meanings.sent2: Her nonpar enthusiasm for the project was noticeable.
meanings.sent3: The nonpar amount of laughter during the movie made it awkward.
meanings.sent4: His nonpar speed in running surprised his coach.
meanings.sent5: The nonpar taste of the dish left a bad impression on the guests.

meanings.sent1: His nonpar skills in painting set him apart from the other artists.
meanings.sent2: The nonpar quality of the product disappointed the customers.
meanings.sent3: The nonpar behavior of the cat made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her nonpar singing ability impressed the judges.
meanings.sent5: The nonpar performance of the team led to their defeat.
